member.name: T:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.ShortcutsCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of shortcuts in a .

remarks.p: The ShortcutsCollection class encapsulates the shortcuts in the . The shortcuts collection of a OutlookShortcutBar can be used to manage shortcuts.

You can add shortcuts to the collection in several ways. The method adds one shortcut to the collection. To insert an shortcut at a specific location within the collection, you can use the method. To remove shortcut in the collection you can use the method.

In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing shortcuts, the ShortcutsCollection also provides methods to find shortcuts within the collection. The method enables you to determine if an shortcut is a member of the collection. Once you know that the shortcut is located within the collection, you can use the method to determine where the shortcut is located within the collection.

member.remarks: The IndexOf method enables you to determine where an shortcut is located within the collection. To determine if an shortcut is located within the collection before calling this method, use the method.

member.name: P:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.Shortcut.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Shortcut can respond to user interaction.
member.value: true if the Shortcut can respond to user interaction; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: The Enabled property allows Shortcuts to be enabled or disabled at run time. For example, you can disable Shortcuts that do not apply to the current state of the application. You can also disable a Shortcut to restrict its use. For example, it can be disabled to prevent the user from clicking it. If a Shortcut is disabled, it cannot be selected and no event is raised.

member.name: P:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.Shortcut.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the control.
member.value: An that contains data about the control. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks:
Any type derived from the class can be assigned to this property. If the Tag property is set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.
A common use for the Tag property is to store data that is closely associated with the control.

member.name: T:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.OutlookShortcutBar
member.summary: OutlookShortcutBar displays various groups of shortcuts with text and images.

remarks.p: OutlookShortcutBar can be designed in various ways to provide the advanced look and feel of a toolbox or application main screen.
OutlookShortcutBar contains of shortcuts. determines if groups are displayed either as buttons in toolbox (one per line) or as links at the bottom of the control (like tab control).
determines the selected group. Shortcuts of the selected group are displayed, others are hidden.
determines how shortcuts in given group are displayed. This can be either one shortcut per line (as in toolbox), or side by side.
The common look of the groups can be set with OutlookShortCut's properties, the look of the items can be changed per .

member.name: T:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.OutlookMonthCalendar
member.summary: Represents a managed month calendar control.

remarks.p: MonthCalendar control can be used to display and change date . Possible values can be in the range given by and properties.
Dates are displayed one week per line starting with . Week numbers are displayed, if is set.
If is set, button for navigation to is displayed with . TodayDate is highlighted if is set to true.
If is set, button for selecting special none date is displayed with . None date is indicated by property.
To customize the look of the dropdown calendar you can use properties , , , , and .
You can control which days are displayed in bold by dropdown calendar using properties , and . You can also manipulate bolded dates using appropriate Add and Remove methods.

member.name: P:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.OutlookMonthCalendar.DaysOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the letter of days of week.
member.value: An that contains letter of days of week. The default is a empty string, what mean use of default regional setting. In English regional settings it is "SMTWTFS".

remarks.p: This string must be at least 7 characters length. If not, it will append empty space until 7 characters. If you set string with more then 7 characters, all characters over 7 are ignored.
Each letter is the first character of day name and it must start from Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, etc.

member.name: T:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.OutlookDateTimePicker
member.summary: Managed OutlookDateTimePicker control. User can select a day from popup calendar.

remarks.p: OutlookDateTimePicker control can be used to display and change value. Possible can be in the range given by and properties.
Value is displayed according to chosen . If format is custom, property contains the custom datetime format string.
Value of the control can be changed using dropdown calendar or using up-down control, according to property. Aligment of the drop-down calendar can be changed using property.
On dropdown button is displayed. To customize the look of the dropdown calendar you can use properties , , , , and . You can change the of the calendar and also the displayed if is set to true.
You can control which days are displayed in bold by dropdown calendar using properties , and .

member.name: P:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.OutlookDateTimePicker.DaysOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the letter of days of week.
member.value: An that contains letter of days of week. The default is a empty string, what mean use of default regional setting. In English regional settings it is "SMTWTFS".

remarks.p: This string must be at least 7 characters length. If not, it will append empty space until 7 characters. If you set string with more then 7 characters, all characters over 7 are ignored.
Each letter is the first character of day name and it must start from Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, etc.

member.name: P:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.OutlookDateTimePicker.TodayDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is used by OutlookMonthCalendar as today's date.
member.value: A representing today's date. The default value is the current system date.
member.remarks: By default, the TodayDate property returns the current system date. Setting the TodayDate property, the value returned by the TodayDate property is the one the user sets.

member.name: P:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.OutlookDateTimePicker.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with this control. Throws a FormatException if the specified text is not a valid date.
member.value: A string that represents the text associated with this control.
member.remarks:
The string returned by this property is equivalent to the property with the appropriate formatting or custom formatting applied.
When setting this property, the string must be convertible to an instance of the class. It is possible to define a custom format that results in a string that cannot be converted to a valid DateTime value. Because of this, the string returned from the Text property might cause an error if it is passed back to the Text property. If the string cannot be converted to a date/time value, the class throws a .

member.summary: Gets or sets the current day.
member.value: A representing today's date. The default value is the current system date.

member.name: P:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.TouchDateTimePicker.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with this control. Throws a FormatException if the specified text is not a valid date.
member.value: A string that represents the text associated with this control.
member.remarks:
The string returned by this property is equivalent to the property with the appropriate formatting or custom formatting applied.
When setting this property, the string must be convertible to an instance of the class. It is possible to define a custom format that results in a string that cannot be converted to a valid DateTime value. Because of this, the string returned from the Text property might cause an error if it is passed back to the Text property. If the string cannot be converted to a date/time value, the class throws a .

member.name: T:Resco.Controls.OutlookControls.GroupsCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of groups in a .

remarks.p: The GroupsCollection class encapsulates the groups in the . The groups collection of a OutlookShortcutBar can be used to manage groups.

You can add groups to the collection in several ways. The method adds one group to the collection. To insert an group at a specific location within the collection, you can use the method. To remove group in the collection you can use the method.

In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing groups, the GroupsCollection also provides methods to find groups within the collection. The method enables you to determine if an group is a member of the collection. Once you know that the group is located within the collection, you can use the method to determine where the group is located within the collection.
